data_processing.stats_utilities.levene_test(data, exp_param, metric, sig_level=0.05, show_result=True)¶

Scipy Levene test for equal variance (Homoscedasticity). The Levene test tests the null hypothesis that all input samples are from populations with equal variances. Levene’s test is an alternative to Bartlett’s test bartlett in the case where there are significant deviations from normality.

Parameters

  • data (Dataframe) -- Dataframe grouped by model_name and experiment_type values.

  • exp_param (string) -- Indicates which columns values to group data for comparison i.e. vocab_size.

  • metric (string) -- Indicates which column name has the result values i.e. test_acc.

  • sig_level (float) -- The test significance level. Default=0.05.

  • show_result (bool) -- Whether to print the results of the test. Default=True.

Returns

Columns are model_name, t-statistic and p-value.

model_name t-stat p-value

0 cnn 22.431538 0.096978 1 text cnn 13.273237 0.581202 2 dcnn 13.045170 0.598809

Return type

levene_frame (Dataframe)

data_processing.stats_utilities.one_way_anova_test(data, exp_param, metric, sig_level=0.05, show_result=True)¶

ANOVA test with statsmodels.

Eta-squared and omega-squared share the same suggested ranges for effect size classification: Low (0.01 – 0.059) Medium (0.06 – 0.139) Large (0.14+) Omega is considered a better measure of effect size than eta because it is unbiased in it’s calculation.

Parameters

  • data (Dataframe) -- Dataframe grouped by model_name and experiment_type values.

  • exp_param (string) -- Indicates which columns values to group data for comparison i.e. vocab_size.

  • metric (string) -- Indicates which column name has the result values i.e. test_acc.

  • sig_level (float) -- The test significance level. Default=0.05.

  • show_result (bool) -- Whether to print the results of the test. Default=True.

Returns

Contains f-statistic, p-value and eta/omega effect sizes.

F PR(>F) df eta_sq mean_sq omega_sq sum_sq

cnn 5.055341 0.000000 15.0 0.344949 0.000139 0.275461 0.002084 text cnn 4.298028 0.000001 15.0 0.309255 0.000080 0.236169 0.001198 dcnn 3.555700 0.000032 15.0 0.270278 0.000102 0.193286 0.001528

Return type

anova_frame (Dataframe)

data_processing.stats_utilities.shapiro_wilk_test(data, exp_param, metric, sig_level=0.05, show_result=True)¶

Scipy Shapiro-Wilk test for normality. The Shapiro-Wilk test tests the null hypothesis that the data was drawn from a normal distribution.

Parameters

  • data (Dataframe) -- Dataframe grouped by model_name and experiment_type values.

  • exp_param (string) -- Indicates which columns values to group data for comparison i.e. vocab_size.

  • metric (string) -- Indicates which column name has the result values i.e. test_acc.

  • sig_level (float) -- The test significance level. Default=0.05.

  • show_result (bool) -- Whether to print the results of the test. Default=True.

Returns

Columns are model_name, exp_param, t-statistic and p-value.

model_name vocab_size t-stat p-value

0 cnn 500 0.933878 0.487099 1 cnn 1000 0.934968 0.498493 2 cnn 1500 0.904710 0.246593

Return type

shapiro_frame (Dataframe)

data_processing.stats_utilities.t_test(data, exp_param, metric, sig_level=0.05, show_result=True)¶

Scipy T-test for two experiment groups.

Parameters

  • data (Dataframe) -- Dataframe grouped by model_name and experiment_type values.

  • exp_param (string) -- Indicates which columns values to group data for comparison i.e. vocab_size.

  • metric (string) -- Indicates which column name has the result values i.e. test_acc.

  • sig_level (float) -- The test significance level. Default=0.05.

  • show_result (bool) -- Whether to print the results of the test. Default=True.

Returns

Columns are t-statistic and p-value.

t-statistic p-value

0 2.598956 0.011838

Return type

t_test_frame (Dataframe)

data_processing.stats_utilities.tukey_hsd(data, exp_param, metric, sig_level=0.5, show_result=True)¶

ANOVA and Tukey HSD post-hoc comparison from statsmodels.

The Tukey HSD post-hoc comparison test controls for type I error and maintains the family-wise error rate at 0.05. The group1 and group2 columns are the groups being compared, meandiff column is the difference in means of the two groups being calculated as group2 – group1, lower/upper columns are the lower/upper boundaries of the 95% confidence interval, reject column states whether or not the null hypothesis should be rejected.

Parameters

  • data (Dataframe) -- Dataframe grouped by model_name and experiment_type values.

  • exp_param (string) -- Indicates which columns values to group data for comparison i.e. vocab_size.

  • metric (string) -- Indicates which column name has the result values i.e. test_acc.

  • sig_level (float) -- The test significance level. Default=0.05.

  • show_result (bool) -- Whether to print the results of the test. Default=True.

Returns

Contains f-statistic, p-value and eta/omega effect sizes.

model_name group1 group2 meandiff p-value lower upper reject

0 cnn 500 1000 0.0014 0.9000 -0.0021 0.0050 False 1 cnn 500 1500 0.0041 0.0083 0.0006 0.0077 True 2 cnn 500 2000 0.0051 0.0010 0.0016 0.0087 True

Return type

tukey_frame (Dataframe)

data_processing.stats_utilities.two_way_anova_test(data, exp_param1, exp_param2, metric, sig_level=0.05, show_result=True)¶

ANOVA test with statsmodels.

Eta-squared and omega-squared share the same suggested ranges for effect size classification: Low (0.01 – 0.059) Medium (0.06 – 0.139) Large (0.14+) Omega is considered a better measure of effect size than eta because it is unbiased in it’s calculation.

Parameters

  • data (Dataframe) -- Dataframe grouped by model_name and experiment_type values.

  • exp_param1 (string) -- Indicates first columns values to group data for comparison i.e. embedding_dim.

  • exp_param2 (string) -- Indicates second columns values to group data for comparison i.e. embedding_type.

  • metric (string) -- Indicates which column name has the result values i.e. test_acc.

  • sig_level (float) -- The test significance level. Default=0.05.

  • show_result (bool) -- Whether to print the results of the test. Default=True.

Returns

Contains f-statistic, p-value and eta/omega effect sizes.

Return type

anova_frame (Dataframe)

model_name exp_params sum_sq df mean_sq F PR(>F) eta_sq omega_sq

gru C(embedding_dim) 0.000023 4.0 0.000006 0.640506 0.634978 0.024733 -0.013749 gru C(embedding_type) 0.000026 1.0 0.000026 2.944534 0.089609 0.028426 0.018592 gru C(embedding_dim):C(embedding_type) 0.000071 4.0 0.000018 2.020298 0.098257 0.078013 0.039022
